str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
(a) there, yonder, in that place, (b) thither, there. Of uncertain affinity; there; by extension, thither.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: From a derivative of theaomai; to be a spectator of, i.e. Discern, (experience) or intensively (acknowledge).
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
From a (long) distance, afar. Adverb from makros; from a distance or afar.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Feminine Plural
Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To accompany, attend, follow. Properly, to be in the same way with, i.e. To accompany.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Of Hebrew origin; Galiloea, a region of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: From diakonos; to be an attendant, i.e. Wait upon (figuratively) teacher; technically, to act as a Christian deacon.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
